urls.title: The Chilterns AONB - News
urls.description: Buckinghamshire Council and the Chilterns Conservation Board have serious concerns about the impacts of HS2’s tunnelling operations on Buckinghamshire’s aquifer and chalk streams. These concerns relate to pollution resulting from tunnelling operations, increasing abstraction of water and impacts on the flow of significant chalk streams, such as the River Misbourne. A joint Position Statement has been issued with a series of questions regarding these concerns, and the Council and the Chilterns Conservation

tweets.text:
Here is a good statement reflecting our concerns with regard to HS2 Tunnelling and the impact on the chalk aquifer https://t.co/tUIdNMbtSW
It is with sadness we announce a very compliant @EnvAgency have approved the tunnelling without any public consultation.

tweets.text: @Independent @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids @AaronBell4NUL @PHE_uk You really need to investigate this and find out the truth, its something never experienced at this level, we will never find out what is buried but we suspect gypsum with household waste that was banned in 2014, our cries for help were ignored that it was not the normal!
@Samanth33412592 @EnvAgency @RedIndustries2 @SimonTagg @AaronBell4NUL @DefraGovUK @StinkStopthe @Cap_it_off Not if we've got anything to do with it. We will fight them every inch of the way ✊❤️❤️

Basically the issue is @EnvAgency can’t afford to pay for the finishing if they were to close @RedIndustries2 down, so they expected us to live with landfill gas tell 2026 they need holding accountable @SimonTagg @AaronBell4NUL @DefraGovUK @StinkStopthe @Cap_it_off #AirPollution https://t.co/ym8CKAmjgu

tweets.text: @Independent It is a scandal unfolding before our very eyes. Letters sent today👇yet @EnvAgencyMids are allowing the tipping of waste as normal, even though they don’t know why the odour is so bad so may be compounding the issue! Total negligence. #stopthestink https://t.co/IlaGS7Xdv8

tweets.text: Why is it taking locals with drones to keep catching what appears to breaches of permit? No wonder we can’t breathe @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe #stopthestink @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency @MPGeorgeEustice @JamesBevanEA @ClareDinnisEA https://t.co/2uw6AHWugP

Clueless , they’ve been sifting since the increased scrutiny & are still breaking their permits with tyres! @DefraGovUK Where are the invisible @EnvAgency ? @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @MPGeorgeEustice #stopthestink https://t.co/gEYwl4BOXz

tweets.text: @Independent We all told the EA it had changed back in Sept & it was off the scale in our homes & gardens, they said it was fine using old monitoring data, then came the nighttime wall of gas that chocked us in our homes with WHO breaking hydrogen sulphide, PHE were just as bad not listening! https://t.co/Sd70Nx7DE0
@EnvAgencyMids oh and further more on deadline day i'm not saying it is but it looks like plasterboard . @EnvAgencyMids you have one extremely annoyed community now . https://t.co/zahMYGVp6y

tweets.text: @SianieRoo @MattHancock @DefraGovUK @PHE_EoEngland @MPGeorgeEustice @EnvAgency @Cap_it_off I don't look very beautiful at present. I just went to the supermarket (which, like my house, smells of H2S) and caught a glimpse of myself in the car mirror... The lack of sleep and severe stress are showing. It's just getting worse & worse. Time to submit my 4th report today.

@ollyandpatch @SianieRoo @HelenVi00175623 @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @DefraGovUK That's another thing that distresses me. I'm suffering from the poisonous gases and odour but thankfully do not have any respiratory conditions. My heart bleeds for those who are even more negatively and seriously impacted. I hope we can all be relieved of this nightmare soon.
